definition: thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: How does a company remit its profits and dividends and repatriate capital abroad?
sentences.chinese: 該怎樣向國外匯寄其利潤與股息和從國外匯回資本？

sentences.english: Except otherwise stated, performance does take into account of reinvestments and capital gain or loss.
sentences.chinese: 除註明外，表現己考慮股息再投資及資本增長及損失。

sentences.english: The dividend is paid to shareholders in the form of authorized but hitherto unissued shares.
sentences.chinese: 指股東股息的支付是按未公開發行的股票形式。

sentences.english: Dividends are not a distribution of earnings paid to investors by a company or a fund.
sentences.chinese: 股息是一家自己搞或基金給投入資金者的獲利分配。

sentences.english: 'The accused, being shareholders in the company, would have gotten part of the dividend, ' Mr. Narayana said.
sentences.chinese: 納拉亞納說，被起訴人作爲公司股東獲得了部分股息。

sentences.english: High-dividend markets have also performed best so far this century.
sentences.chinese: 到本世紀爲止，高股息市場的發展最爲迅猛。

sentences.english: A prorata portion of earnings usually distributed in cash by a corporation to its stockholders.
sentences.chinese: 股息指公司以現金形式，按比例向股東分配的盈餘。

sentences.english: All three will have any dividends cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 這三家銀行都將取消股息。

sentences.english: After all expenses and dividend, this is the final net figure.
sentences.chinese: 扣去了所有的費用和股息，它就是最終的淨值。

sentences.english: Dividends and P/E ratios aren't as important as earnings per share.
sentences.chinese: 股息和市盈率沒有每股盈利重要。

sentences.english: The results of subsidiaries are accounted for by the company on the basis of dividends received and receivable.
sentences.chinese: 附屬公司的業績由本公司根據已收及應收的股息入帳。

sentences.english: You can check the list of duty-free articles.
sentences.chinese: 財政法中的一覽表，在此表中列出對股息的徵稅。

sentences.english: The results of associated companies are accounted for by the company on the basis of dividends received and receivable.
sentences.chinese: 聯營公司的業績由本公司根據已收及應收的股息入帳。

sentences.english: Dividends from food and beverage companies are in fashion this spring.
sentences.chinese: 今年春天餐飲公司的股息問題成爲一種時尚。

sentences.english: One only receives the dividend if the share is bought before the ex-dividend date.
sentences.chinese: 只有在除權日期之前購買股票才能享有股息。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, many stocks are paying dividends of 4% and up.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，很多股票派發的股息在4%以上。

definition: (economics) bonus stock or share, i.e. share issued fully or partly paid to an existing shareholder in a company, generally on a pro rata basis
